info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 25 at 8:21PM CDT until May 30 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Clear Boggy Creek near Caney affecting Atoka County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Clear Boggy Creek near Caney.
* WHEN...From Monday morning to early Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Creek levels rise to slightly above bankfull stages in western Atoka County and the northeastern edge of Bryan County. High stages on small feeder streams result in even greater depths to mainstem bottomlands near their points of entry into Clear Boggy Creek. Only croplands... pastures... and some secondary rural roads are affected.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 24.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 26.0 feet. - Forecast...The Clear Boggy Creek is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 27.2 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING
